content:
Diagnosis:	Clear cell renal cell carcinoma, right kidney, T1bN0M0

CT abdomen/pelvis 15 March 2024 showed 5.2cm mass in right kidney lower pole, no evidence of local invasion or lymphadenopathy. CT chest same date showed no evidence of metastatic disease. PET-CT 22 March 2024 confirmed solitary right renal mass with no evidence of distant disease.

[redacted name] is a 64-year-old gentleman who was recently diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma following investigation of microscopic haematuria. He is otherwise well with good performance status (WHO PS 0). He has well-controlled hypertension on ramipril 5mg daily but no other significant medical history. He is an ex-smoker having quit 10 years ago.

On examination today, he is comfortable at rest with normal vital signs. Abdominal examination reveals no masses or tenderness. Chest is clear.

I have discussed his case with [redacted name] from urology. Given the size and location of the tumor, he is suitable for partial nephrectomy. This has been discussed with the patient today who wishes to proceed. I have explained the procedure, including potential risks and recovery period. His case will be discussed at next week's uro-oncology MDT.

The plan is for surgical resection followed by surveillance. Given the stage and PD-L1 negative status, adjuvant therapy is not indicated. We will arrange follow-up CT chest/abdomen/pelvis at 3 months post-surgery.
